subject: Travel
title: Supersonic Travel Returns
description: A fast breakdown of Supersonic Travel Returns for builders.

hook.text: Twenty years after the Concorde retired, several startups are building new supersonic airliners.

buildup.text: Boom Supersonic plans a 65-seat jet called Overture that could fly New York to London in 3.5 hours.

discovery.text: New engine designs are quieter and more efficient. The sonic boom problem may finally be solvable.

twist.text: NASA is testing a quiet supersonic jet called X-59. Its boom sounds like a gentle thump, not a crack.

climax.text: Airlines have already placed pre-orders. Supersonic commercial flights could return by the late 2020s.

punchline.text: Faster-than-sound flying is making a quiet comeback.

quiz.question: What was a major problem with the Concorde that new designs aim to solve?
